text: Pyrausta cardinalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Achille Guenée in 1854. It is found in Florida, Cuba, the Dominican Republic and on the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.Pyrausta cardinalis, a new continental record (Lepidoptera: Crambidae) The wingspan is about 12 mm. The wings are translucent pink with a large black patch on forewings and a black terminal area on the hindwings. There is orange scaling on the head, thorax and the base of the forewings. Adults have been recorded on wing in March in Florida. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1854 cardinalis Category:Moths of North America
title: Pyrausta cardinalis
